summary: This document is a detailed timeline of the events surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019. It records the activation of a body alarm, the discovery of Epstein unresponsive in his cell, the initiation of CPR and medical interventions, his transport to Beekman Hospital, and the official declaration of death. The document concludes with the body being released to the Medical Examiner for autopsy.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The timeline details the medical response to his condition and his subsequent death.

persons.name: ER Physician
persons.context: The medical professional at Beekman Hospital who officially reported the time of death for Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 am, a body alarm was activated in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). Staff found inmate Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell and initiated CPR.

events.title: Medical Emergency Response
events.description: From 6:33 am onward, staff and medical personnel performed CPR, applied an AED, and administered medical interventions (Epinephrine, intubation, IV/IO access) on Epstein. EMS arrived and continued efforts.

events.title: Transport to Hospital and Time of Death
events.description: Epstein was transported to Beekman Hospital. At 7:36 am, an ER physician officially reported the time of death.

events.title: Body Processing and Release to Medical Examiner
events.description: Correctional officials transported Epstein's body to Beekman Hospital for fingerprinting and photographs. His clothing was secured as evidence. The body was released to the Medical Examiner (ME) for autopsy at 12:15 pm.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) / Institution (implied location of SHU and initial incident)
Beekman Hospital (destination for medical transport and where time of death was declared)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at 6:33 am on August 10, 2019.
Despite immediate CPR and advanced medical interventions by on-site staff and EMS, Epstein remained unresponsive and showed no pulse.
Epstein was officially declared dead by an ER physician at Beekman Hospital at 7:36 am on August 10, 2019.
His body was processed (fingerprints, photographs) at the hospital and then released to the Medical Examiner for an autopsy at 12:15 pm the same day.
The document provides a minute-by-minute procedural account of the response to Epstein's medical emergency and death.
